--- title: "5.3 — Antitrust II: The Paradox — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance=minimal} # Meeting Date *Tuesday, April 25, 2023* ::: ## Overview Today we continue our examination of antitrust law by looking at how antitrust theory and practice have dramatically changed since the 1970s, largely as a result of Robert Bork’s book *The Antitrust Paradox*, and the adoption of the [“Consumer Welfare standard.”](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consumer_welfare_standard) We also turn to take a more critical look at the history of the U.S. in the [Progressive Era](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_Era) to address three questions: 1. Why were most economists against (or at least, not in favor of) the Sherman Act? 2. Did the industries accused of forming “trusts” and monopolies *actually* behave like monopolies? 3. What was the original intent and purpose of the Sherman Act? ## Readings ### Recommended Readings: - [ Crandall and Winston, 2003, "Does Antitrust Policy Improve Consumer Welfare? Assessing the Evidence"](/files/readings/Crandall-Winston-2003.pdf) - [ Kovacic and Shapiro, 2000, "Antitrust Policy: A Century of Economic and Legal Thinking"](/files/readings/Kovacic-Shapiro-2000.pdf) - [ DiLorenzo, 1985, "The Origins of Antitrust: An Interest-Group Perspective"](/files/readings/DiLorenzo-1985.pdf) - [ DiLorenzo and High, 1988, "Antitrust and Competition, Historically Considered"](/files/readings/DiLorenzo-High-1988.pdf) - [ McGee, 1958, "Predatory Price Cutting: The Standard Oil (N.J.) Case"](/files/readings/McGee-1958.pdf) - [ Demsetz, 1973, "Industry Structure, Market Rivalry, and Public Policy"](/files/readings/Demsetz-1973.pdf) - [ Bork, 1966, "Legislative Intent and the Policy of the Sherman Act"](/files/readings/Bork-1966.pdf) - [ Hazlett, 1992, "The Legislative History of the Sherman Act Re-Examined"](/files/readings/Hazlett-1992.pdf) - [ Stigler, 1971, "The Theory of Economic Regulation"](/files/readings/Stigler-1971.pdf) - [ Stigler, 1982, "The Economists and the Problem of Monopoly"](/files/readings/Stigler-1982.pdf) - [ Williamson, 1968, "Economies as an Antitrust Defense: The Welfare Tradeoffs"](/files/readings/Williamson-1968.pdf) - [ *EconTalk*: "Michael Munger on Antitrust"](https://www.econtalk.org/michael-munger-on-antitrust/) - [ *NPR Planet Money*: "Antitrust 1: Standard Oil"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2019/02/15/695131832/antitrust-1-standard-oil) - [ *NPR Planet Money*: "Antitrust 2: The Paradox"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2019/02/20/696342011/antitrust-2-the-paradox) - [ *NPR Planet Money*: "Antitrust 3: Big Tech"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2019/02/22/697170790/antitrust-3-big-tech) - [ *Capitalisn't*: "Antitrust Pt 1: The Establishment"](https://www.capitalisnt.com/episodes/a2603962) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab.
